issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: The ShuffleHandler does not have any configurable limits to the number of outstanding connections allowed.  Therefore a node with many map outputs and many reducers in the cluster trying to fetch those outputs can exhaust a nodemanager out of file descriptors.
fields.summary: Shuffle does not limit number of outstanding connections

comments.body: AFAIK there is no built-in way to have Netty automatically limit the number of active client connections.  A quick search on the net indicates one way this is handled is to simply close the extra connections as soon as they are created once we get past a specified number of active connections.
The following may be handy: https://issues.jboss.org/browse/NETTY-311

netty seems to be more geared to limit connections per IP.
Extended the idea provided by Jason (thanks for the code snippet).

Thanks for the patch Rob. There seems to be a race condition in the testMaxConnections test. 

On my desktop I get two different results consistently.

First: 
Failed tests:   testMaxConnections(org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TestShuffleHandler): expected:<2> but was:<1>

Second:
Tests in error: 
  testSerializeMeta(org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TestShuffleHandler): test timed out after 2000 milliseconds
  testShuffleMetrics(org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TestShuffleHandler): test timed out after 2000 milliseconds
  testClientClosesConnection(org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TestShuffleHandler): test timed out after 2000 milliseconds
  testMaxConnections(org.apache.hadoop.mapred.TestShuffleHandler): test timed out after 2000 milliseconds

John,
I modified the test to try to open numerous connections and then verify the max is not reached.  Thus eliminating the need do check the connect count repeatedly. test-patch.sh passed locally as did mvn test -Dtest=TestShuffleHandler.
